description.narrative:
n Zimbabwe's drylands there is a health crisis as safe wter, adequate santiation and hygiene are tenous. Water of accetable quality is not regularly available to 85 % Services have deteriorated, boreholes are defunct and now new wter supplies re developed. Thus, people resort to unprotected water suppleis: open surface dams, rivers pools and natural pans, which are almost always contaminated resulting in intestinal compliactions, worms and waterborne disease. This in turn leads to poor health, stunted grwoth and under-weight. Diarrhoea is reported in 11.5/100 persons and is increasingly sharply.
Sanitary toilet systems are required that can be easily kept clean and prevent, rather than cause, diarrhoea and other diseases. Yet only 40 % have access to latrines. There is furthera disturbing lack of awareness of the need for hygiene rergarding toilet use and hand washing. In Gwanda disrict rural people, mostly womeh, have to face these water supply and health challenges on their own and must rely on their own capaicty to address them.
The target group's main problem is pronounced water shortage for all domestic purposes - leading to poverty, malnutrition and poor health. In order to address these shortcomings communities need to create self-reliance, ownership and responsibility for their watersupply - whether to be developed or rehabiliated. Basic water abstraction systems and maintenance methods are needed, tailor made to resource They should be manageable, be simple in design, only require basic tools and be affordable. They are to have prolonged servicer intervals and use components that can be largely improvised from readily available materials. (This component contains the project activities/costs executed by Oxfam Novib)

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib was founded in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Oxfam Novib is member of the Oxfam International confederation. Working together in the confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novib's main office is based in The Netherlands, it supports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fundraising, campaigning and advocacy. Oxfam Novib’s the Hague office contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: no. of women and men (small-scale crop farmers, cattle farmers, fisher folk) able to use sustainable production methods enabling them to better protect and use sustainably their livelihood resources
